text: ## Tools, Apps, and Software
### Text Editors
- [iA Writer]({{$url0}}): The best Markdown syntax editor with simplicity as its main advantage, though it lacks note organization and related features.
- [Paper]({{$url0}}): A great candidate to replace iA Writer, offering an enhanced writing experience but has some bugs and limitations suitable only for simple notes.
- [Obsidian]({{$url0}}): Ideal for organizing content, often used in conjunction with [Vitepress]({{$url1}}) to share notes online as a static website.
- [Notion]({{$url0}}): Primarily used for collaboration, content creation, sharing, and leveraging automation with its available API.
### Task Management
- [Linear]({{$url0}}): Used for organizing work with strong API connectivity and customization options, allowing task automation and integration with other tools.
- [Todoist]({{$url0}}): Offers APIs for nearly unrestricted data management, praised for its clear GUI and keyboard shortcuts.
### Email
- [Google Workspace]({{$url0}}): Essential for email management with strong automation capabilities through Gmail.
- [Superhuman]({{$url0}}): Enhances Gmail with powerful automation and a user-friendly interface, supporting keyboard shortcuts for efficient email handling.
- [make.com]({{$url0}}): Used for setting up automation scenarios, such as handling labeled emails and integrating with other services.
### Calendar
- [Zencal]({{$url0}}): A tool for scheduling meetings with pre-set time blocks that adjust automatically based on your calendar.
- [Notion Calendar]({{$url0}}): An intuitive calendar app that integrates with Notion, offering keyboard shortcuts and a minimalist interface.
### Web Browsing
- [Arc Browser]({{$url0}}): The main browser used, featuring Command Bar and Little Arc for enhanced navigation.
- [Feedly]({{$url0}}): Used for staying updated and monitoring news, integrated with [Make.com]({{$url1}}) for automations.
- [Product Hunt]({{$url0}}): A platform for discovering new products and tools.
- [daily.dev]({{$url0}}): A site for developers to stay updated with daily coding news and updates.
- [Indie Hackers]({{$url0}}): A community platform for indie entrepreneurs to share and discover business insights.
- [HackerNews]({{$url0}}): A news aggregator focusing on computer science and entrepreneurship.
### Graphic Design
- [Figma]({{$url0}}): The best tool for UI design and creating advertisements, offering components and auto-layout features.
- [Adobe Photoshop Beta]({{$url0}}): Recently used for its Generative AI features, excellent for editing images and assets.
- [Midjourney]({{$url0}}): Used for generating graphic or asset variants, often combined with Photoshop for editing.
- [Adobe Firefly]({{$url0}}): Utilized for slight editing of generated images from Midjourney.
- [Webflow]({{$url0}}): Combines with [HTMLCSSToImage]({{$url1}}) for automatic generation of graphics based on templates.
- [HTMLCSSToImage]({{$url0}}): Allows automatic generation of graphics using HTML templates.
### Programming
- [IntelliJ IDEA]({{$url0}}): The main code editor used for programming in TypeScript and Rust, praised for understanding code better than alternatives.
- [Supermaven]({{$url0}}): An alternative to GitHub Copilot, intelligently suggests code.
- [iTerm]({{$url0}}): The preferred terminal for its simplicity and performance.
- [TablePlus]({{$url0}}): A great database client for macOS.
- [Raycast]({{$url0}}): Used for searching menu items and executing actions without keyboard shortcuts.
- [GitHub Actions]({{$url0}}): Utilized for automating code tasks and application deployment.
### Macros and Automations
- [Shortcuts]({{$url0}}): Used for creating macros and automations on Apple devices.
- [Keyboard Maestro]({{$url0}}): A tool for automating keyboard actions and macros.
- [Better Touch Tool]({{$url0}}): Enhances touchpad and mouse functionality with customizable gestures.
- [Raycast]({{$url0}}): Integrates with macros and automations for streamlined workflows.
- [make.com]({{$url0}}): Powers automations by connecting various applications through APIs.
### Fun
- [Amazon Kindle]({{$url0}}): Used for reading e-books with synced progress across devices.
- [Audible]({{$url0}}): Utilized for listening to audiobooks with progress syncing.
- [PlayStation 5]({{$url0}}): The primary gaming console used.
- [Nvidia GeForce Now]({{$url0}}): Used for game streaming from the Steam account.
- [Steam Deck]({{$url0}}): An impressive handheld gaming device.
- [Nintendo Switch]({{$url0}}): Another gaming console used on the go.
- [Spotify]({{$url0}}): Preferred music streaming service with API and cross-platform functionality.
- [endel.io]({{$url0}}): Used for focus music while programming, designing, or writing longer texts.
### AI and Automation Tools
- [GPT-4]({{$url0}}): Assists in writing by correcting and enhancing readability, brainstorming, and discussions.
- [Claude]({{$url0}}): Similar to GPT-4, used for assisting in writing and brainstorming.
- [Vitepress]({{$url0}}): Pairs with Obsidian for sharing notes online.
- [Algolia]({{$url0}}): Integrated with Feedly for search functionalities in long-term memory.
- [Qdrant]({{$url0}}): Works with Feedly for enhanced search capabilities.
- [Ray.so]({{$url0}}): Generates code snippets via Puppeteer automation macro.
- [TinyPNG]({{$url0}}): Optimizes images through automation macros.
- [Dropshare]({{$url0}}): Shares images and files efficiently.
- [DigitalOcean]({{$url0}}): Hosts images and files.
- [HTMLCSSToImage]({{$url0}}): Converts HTML to images for graphic automation.
